comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9F02E6D61E3AE633A... February 22, 1913 LORD KNOLLYS TO RETIRE.; Confidant of British Royal House for 45 Years, He Served Three Monarchs. LONDON, Feb. 21. -- Lord Knollys is about to relinquish the office of Private Secretary to the King. He has be the trusted councillor of the roy house for forty-five years, and has served three monarchs. He has been aptly described as "the most tactful man in Europe." See www.nationmaster.com/encyclopedia/Lord-Knollys

comment.author: 8623220@N02
comment._content: Richard Arthur Norton (1958-) and swanq: Thanks for the additional information on Lord Knollys. We'll add more details to the source data and then reload the description to Flickr.

comment._content: See www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/3909867868/ for a picture in the New-York Tribune -- with pictures of other private secretaries to famous people.
